comments:
Not sure why there is an entry "Open Javadoc wizard..." in the context menu in
the Ant editor.

The Javadoc wizard creates an ANT file that does a Javadoc export wizard. You
can open this again with the Javado wizard.
The action is currently contributed on all 'ant' xml files.
I'm not aware of a possibilty to be more specific.

Hhmm ... 

I have an empty Java project (no sources, only the HelloWorld.xml Ant buildfile 
from the manual). If you choose "Project > Generate Javadoc..." from the 
Eclipse menu the wizard opens, if I choose "Open Javadoc wizard..." from the 
contextmenu in the Ant editor I got nothing.

Started with "-debug -consolelog" gave no output.

Used Eclipse 3.1 M3.
What do you mean by 'get nothing'. No wizard opens? Can you check your .log file?
No, no wizard opens. But where should the logfile be? Could not find any.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ant.ui 4 120 2004-12-16 08:29:45.536
!MESSAGE Error logged from Ant UI:

The exception reported appears to be a duplicate of bug 81274.

First view seems to be the same. Line numbers differ. But - sorry - that?s your 
turn. :-)

Can you try to open the wizard again and see if a different problem is logged?
This stack trace doesn't seem to be related.

Ok, I delete the log file and retry ...

... no log created???

Retry with "-debug"

... no log.

Is there any other parameter I can try? Or anything else for getting a
meaningful log? (E.g. for future reports :)
it will be recreated as soon as an error is written to it.

So it seems that there is no "error". But there is no reaction to the choice I
made. Isn?t there any build-in logging capability in Eclipse? And could you
recreate that behaviour?

Darin, any idea how I can do further refinements so that I only show up on
antfiles that really contain a javadoc target?

You would have to do some parsing of the buildfile to check for a sub element 
of a target that was named javadoc OR (much better) the ant buildfile that is 
created by the javadoc wizard could add a top level XML processing instruction 
that flagged that buildfile as relevant...fast and easy to check for this

No change in
